All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AbstractAlgorithm
AbstractAlgorithm serves as the base class for implementing various product arrangement algorithms.
AddProductView
The AddProductView class represents a dialog for adding products to a list.
AdminUser
Represents an admin user in the system.
BasicView
The `BasicView` class serves as an abstract base class for various views in the presentation layer.
BruteForceAlgorithm
BruteForceAlgorithm is an extension of AbstractAlgorithm that arranges a Productlist by evaluating all possible combinations to maximize their total similarity.
ControllerDomain
ControllerDomain Manages the main operations of the application, including handling products, product lists, shelves, and data file processing.
ControllerPersistence
ControllerPersistence
CreateShelfView
The CreateShelfView class represents the GUI for creating a new shelf.
CurrentUser
Represents the currently active user in the system.
DesignUtils
The DesignUtils class provides utility methods for configuring the design and appearance of various Swing components.
Distribution
The Distribution class represents a distribution system for arranging products.
DistributionException
 
DistributionManager
Manages the distributions of products.
DistributionManager.SingletonHelper
Helper class for singleton instance of DistributionManager.
DriverControllerDomain
DriverControllerDomain class.
DriverPresentation
The `DriverPresentation` class serves as the entry point for the presentation layer of the application.
DriverProductManager
Driver class to test the functionalities of ProductManager.
GenerateDistributionView
The GenerateDistributionView class represents the GUI for generating a new distribution on a Shelf.
HillClimbingAlgorithm
HillClimbingAlgorithm is an extension of AbstractAlgorithm designed to optimize the arrangement of a list of products using Hill Climbing.
InputManager
CommandParser class.
InputManagerException
 
LoginView
The `LoginView` class represents the graphical user interface for the login screen of the application.
ManageDistributionsView
The ManageDistributionsView class represents the GUI for managing distributions of a shelf.
MenuView
The MenuView class represents the main menu window of the application.
NoActiveUserException
Exception thrown when there is no active user in the system.
OperationLogView
This class represents the view for displaying the operation log.
Pair<K,V>
The `Pair` class represents a pair of elements, which is an ordered collection of two elements.
ParserException
 
PresentationController
The PresentationController class represents the controller for the presentation layer.
Product
Represents a product with a name, category, price, and amount.
ProductCatalogView
The ProductCatalogView class represents the view for displaying and managing the product catalog.
ProductException
 
ProductList
Represents a list of products with a specific category.
ProductListException
 
ProductListMenuView
ProductListMenuView
ProductListView
The ProductListView class represents the view for displaying and managing a list of products.
ProductManager
ProductManager Manages multiple product lists, providing methods to add, remove, and edit products.
ProductManagerData
ProductManagerData Brief: Class responsible for managing the product catalog data.
Shelf
A class representing a shelf for storing products with a defined capacity.
ShelfException
 
ShelfView
The ShelfView class represents the GUI for managing shelves.
ShowDistributionView
The ShowDistributionView class represents the GUI for displaying a distribution.
SimilaritiesDialog
SimilaritiesDialog
Similarity
The `Similarity` class represents a similarity between two products.
TupleType
The `TupleType` class represents a tuple, which is an ordered collection of elements.
UnauthorizedAccessException
 
User
Represents a user in the system.
UserException
 
UserManager
This class manages user operations such as registration, login, and data management.
UserManagerData
UserManagerData
UserSet
This class represents a set of users and provides methods to manage them.
